Reviews.Title: Fine Camera, what a Point and Shoot is supposed to be
Reviews.Author: Juan Carlos R. Laguardia "Stat Grad Student"
Reviews.Content: Already being an owner and user of two different camera types, DSLR and film, I felt I was missing out on the point and shoot category.  So, I researched upcoming cameras in June and heard about Panasonic's new Lumix lineup and didn't wait any time to pre order this guy.  It is very compact (smaller than a deck of cards) with a serious range 8x zoom.  Just be sure you want a camera that takes all the manual control of picture taking before you buy it.  There is almost no manual settings, other than choosing which "scene" you think your shot will be.  Panasonic has some fun settings - Pin Hole, film grain, and the key word that people love "High Dynamic" mode, which is their attempt to create a High Dynamic Range type of shot.  They also have an underwater setting, for those who will later shell out the money for the casing to take this baby in the pool or some other form of wet.  The Leica name on the lens is what got me looking at panasonic cameras, and as far as I can tell, its a fine lens.  It is no DSLR, but it is a great incognito camera.Video is Average, but I wasn't really concerned about it.  -- When I say average, I'm comparing it to video I've seen taken from a camcorder.  The HD component is nice, but you'd need to be still holding it and hope whatever you're filming is not moving too fast for a great recording.

Reviews.Title: Buying decision: 720p HD Video, 8x Zoom, Power O.I.S.
Reviews.Author: I. Besenfelder
Reviews.Content: The Lumix ZR1 is a very good snapshot and HD video camera.I got the ZR1 around a month ago and I am still enthusiastic. The most important things besides picture quality were for me, that the cam should be fast and able to zoom while recording HD video. I hate the low res VGA videos, the older generation cams made. You can't use them for anything. My first reference was the Lumix ZS3, which is a really good camera and it had all I wanted... Until I found out, that some experts claimed that the "Mega Optical Image Stabilizer" works a bit slow, so that when taking snapshots there is a longer focus time. But I was lucky, that Panasonic just released this little beauty here. The ZR1 uses a newer much faster OIS, called "Power OIS", which is even faster than most other snapshot cameras, while canceling camera shakes very well. So for me there was no time to wait and get this thing.If you are not so focused on speed, check out the ZS3!Main differences between the SR1 and the ZS3:SR1:- 12MP- Zoom-able 720p HD Video- Power O.I.S.- 8x Zoom- 2.7" displayZS3:- 10MP- Zoom-able 720p HD Video- Mega O.I.S.- 12x Zoom- 3" displayComments on the comparison:- Megapixels aren't the point anyway, because even 8MP are very enough for the normal user, but I had to mention the difference.- Both cams record the same HD Video, so that's also no point- The OIS made a difference for me: "Power" is faster than "Mega". I think they just fixed a software issue here.- Zooming while recording video is a nice and (by this time) rare feature at snapshot cameras. Either zoom, 8x and 12x is huge! Of course 12x would be better than 8x, so this point goes to the ZS3.- Also the display of the ZS3 is bigger.Conclusion: If you don't care how fast your stabilized auto focus is (perhaps you use tripods so that you don't need a OIS, or have always time to make your shoot - it's really NOT that bad, it's just a bit slower), get the ZS3 (zoom and display is better)! Otherwise the ZR1 is perfect (fast and still fat zooming).

Reviews.Title: Not up to expectations
Reviews.Author: Ganesh Ramamoorthy "Scientifix"
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of both Panasonic ZS3 and Panasonic ZR1 and I decided to check out the ZR1 as it was supposed to have the newer/better image stabilization and smaller in size. The size was definitely small enough and image stabilization was decent. The picture quality was quite good in bright light conditions but lower in low-light conditions, but this seems to be an issue with any of the digital cameras at this price point.But where it really disappointed was in the video mode. I noticed that when I switch the mode dial to the video mode the brightness of what was displayed on the camera's LCD screen became much lower compared to the photo mode. First I thought that this may be just an issue I'm seeing on LCD screen but when I transferred the video and watched it on my laptop and my TV I saw that the videos in fact looked dulled out compared to the photos. So pretty much any video that is shot indoors looked dull and kinda of poor quality.I then decided to try out the ZS3 also and immediately saw that this issue isn't there in the ZS3. To capture video on the ZS3 you don't have to change the mode dial but simply have to press a "record" button and I don't know if this has anything to do with this, but the videos were as bright as the photos on the ZS3. So the videos shot indoors are much better, both brighter and better quality, with the ZS3 compared to the ZR1.I also did comparisons of photos taken by the two models and surprisingly I felt the ZS3 was better there too (despite the fact that ZR1 boasts 2MP more). Also, I didn't find the image stabilization of ZS3 in anyway inferior to that of ZR1.So after all my side-by-side comparisons I found the ZS3 to be definitely a better camera which I have kept and returned the ZR1. The ZR1 is definitely more compact than the ZS3 and does have quicker start up times (and possibly even faster zoom times). But, at the end of the day, in my opinion the ZS3 is a superior camera when it comes to videos and even photos, with the additional zoom capabilities (12X of ZS3 vs 8X in ZR1).

Reviews.Title: Be realistic
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: Stop the nonsense!  This is a tiny camera - smaller than a deck of cards with an F3.3 lens and a necessarily tiny ccd, and people are expecting low light capability from it.  Get real!  Photography requires light.  When you give this little thing light, it does an amazing job!  Yes the images at night with poor incandescent light and without flash are grainy.  Does anyone remember the grainy images from film cameras with pushed 400 iso? If you want a low light camera, get a big heavy camera with a large sensor and a nice F1.8 lens.  If you want a tiny gem of an engineering miracle that takes sharp, well exposed, true colored photographs, get this little Lumix ZR1! It does everything one can rationally expect, given the laws of Physics, and does them extremely well!

Reviews.Title: Good, but I like the ZS3 better
Reviews.Author: B. Bass
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time lately reviewing compact digital cameras.  I knew that zoom was one of my highest priorities so I ended up settling on the panasonics.  I have now owned both the ZR1 and ZS3 and I prefer and will keep the ZS3, although it is a very close call.  Both cameras are pretty much the exact same as far as operation and menus go.  They each have iA and normal modes, to go along with twenty something scene modes like high sensitivity, high speed burst, portrait, starry sky, fireworks, etc...  There is definitely the most control in Normal Picture mode, and that is the mode I take almost all of my pictures in.  I never use the iA (intelligent auto) mode.  While they are billed as fully automatic cameras with no manual controls, you can choose the sensitivity (ISO 80-1600, auto), adjust the exposure (-2 to +2 eV), choose a minimum shutter speed (1 to 1/125 for ZR1, 1 to 1/250 for ZS3), which , while it is not capable of extremely long exposures, it is effective at forcing a very fast shutter speed if you are trying to get action shots.  You can also set the white balance.  Both cameras also have a button for a quick menu which brings up relevant parameters you might want to alter in that mode so you don't have to scroll through the menus.  For instance, in normal mode, if you press the quick menu button, Auto focus mode, white balance selection, ISO, picture size, aspect ratio, burst mode, LCD power all pop up on the top of the screen for easy access.  I only wish that the minimum shutter speed control would also pop up with the quick menu,  Each camera also comes with an extended optical zoom, where you can get an extra zoom by reducing the picture size.  With this feature, the ZR1 moves from a 8x zoom to 15.6x, and ZS3 goes from 12x to 21.4x.  Here I must give a point to the ZR1.  The ZS3 puts a much greater emphasis on video, and I really don't care about video.  There is a little red button on the back of the ZS3 that automatically records video, you don't have to be in motion picture mode.  In its place on the ZR1 is an E. zoom button.  This button automatically zooms the camera to full tele (8x) and if you press it twice it automatically extends the lens to its full capabilities, 15.6x.  On the ZS3, you have to go to the menus and manually lower the picture size to attain your extended zoom, rather than just press a button.  I like the ZR1's take on this much better, but if you care about video, you might like this part of the ZS3 better.Of the two, the ZR1 is quite a bit smaller, and weighs 50% less.  I didn't know how much of a difference this actually makes until I actually held both of them in my hands.  If size is your number one priority you might want to go with the ZR1.  I never wear jeans, so I'm not sure how well it would work with them, because I know some people have complained about the ZS3 not being pocketable.  I always wear basketball shorts or wind pants, and the ZS3 easily fits into my pockets.  Though it is heavier and therefore feels less comfortable and less natural, I also have had no real problems using the ZS3 with one hand.  The ZR1 also focuses a little faster than the ZS3, though this difference only becomes really noticeable when zoomed in under low light conditions.  Both cameras seem to take about the same amount of time to extend to their fullest zoom, but the ZR1 can retract back to wide angle a little faster.  The ZR1 starts up marginally faster than the ZS3, though this is also barely noticeable.  When on a tripod, the image quality of both is good, I couldn't tell a difference really in the two on my computer screen, but there is noticeable noise at low light in both starting at ISO 200.  If anything, I think the ZR1 actually reproduces colors a little better than the ZS3, though neither one is bad.  The ZR1 also has pretty good battery life for a compact camera.  It actually uses the exact same battery as the ZS3, which has a much greater power need, so the ZR1 will get good battery life, and noticeably better than the ZS3.  Where the ZR1 falls short is on indoor photos.  The ZR1 has a much narrower aperture, so it lets in less light.  This makes it hard to take photos in low light, and as a result, you must use a slower shutter speed, which will result in blurry pictures when taking handheld pictures.  I would say that about half of my pictures taken inside with the ZR1 came out blurry.  Panasonic says that this isn't a problem because of the new Power O.I.S., but image stabilization can not fix everything.  I am also not convinced that the Power O.I.S. is any better than the older Mega O.I.S.  At any rate, more of my pictures came out blurry with the ZR1 than the ZS3.  Also, the newest Panasonics, released January 2010, are equipped with Mega O.I.S and not Power, which is kind of interesting.ZR1Pros- SMALLER SIZE AND WEIGHT!- Feels more comfortable in hand, looks sleeker, more attractive- E. zoom button in place of movie record button- Better battery life- Slightly faster focusing, especially when zoomed in under low light- Faster response in general (very slightly)- Has two additional scene modes that ZS3 doesn't haveZS3Pros- Wider minimum aperture lets it take much CLEARER HANDHELD PICTURES- EXTRA ZOOM- BETTER LOW LIGHT PERFORMANCE- Better HD video, with an HDMI out port- Better overall image quality- Shutter control down to 1/250 second instead of 1/125- I believe the ZS3 burst mode is a little better- Higher resolution screenOverall, the ZR1 is a very good camera I think, unless you plan to do a lot of indoor shots.  I never use the flash with a camera if I can help it, so if you plan on using the flash whenever you are inside, the ZR1 will be fine for you.  Without the flash, it was just too hard to get a clear shot indoors, especially if you have the lens extended at all.  It is your typical compact camera size, with good speed and picture quality, and the best zoom I could find in a camera this small.  I'm used to using my parents' camera which is a lot higher end and has much more as far as manual controls, but there are not a lot of choices in compact point and shoots with manual controls.  It is extremely easy to use, I don't think anybody will really have a problem operating it.  The menus are very intuitive, and the quick menu will pop up most of the things you might want to fiddle with to get the picture you want.  The camera also feels very good in the hand, and feels like it is made well  It comes with a CD that is the user's manual, which does a pretty good job of explaining what all the scene modes and features of the camera do.  For a camera with no manual controls this one does have a lot of features, and does give you more control than just point and shoot as some would imply.  I was generally well pleased with the picture quality of this camera for the price.  I guess you just have to be realistic and realize that one this small cannot excel at everything, and this camera was made for good lighting rather than indoor shots.

Reviews.Title: Remarkable for such a compact camera
Reviews.Author: Derek Crane
Reviews.Content: I have owned a Panasonic FX35 for almost two years and been very pleased with its handling and performance for a camera so small.  When I saw the Panasonic ZR1 with double the zoom range (25-200mm compared to 25-100mm for the FX35) I decided to upgrade.  Both cameras are the same size.  The FX35 was good.  The ZR1 is even better.  Having 8x zoom in a camera weighing less than 6oz is astounding. Not only that, but there are two other new features I have grown to appreciate: High Dynamic scene mode and improved image stabilization (anti-shake). This combination means that virtually every photo is a keeper, especially if you shoot both standard and High Dynamic of the same scene and compare--one will be perfect.  High Dynamic opens up images with shadows or dimmer interior shots in a more natural way than flash, which I only use as a last resort.  The improved anti-shake system allows use of the full 200mm end of the zoom if you have reasonably steady hands in good daylight.  Add the reasonable price and this is a great camera.  After three months of use, I haven't encountered a downside.  Perhaps that's because I also have a DSLR for more demanding shooting, but for people, pets and travel, it is the best I have owned and I've been a photography buff for 45 years and owned more than 30 cameras.

Reviews.Title: Excellent outdoor camera, poor low light  indoor performance
Reviews.Author: quest754
Reviews.Content: After seeing drastically different review on this camera, you must be confused and puzzled. How can the same camera bring different results to different users?The key is under what condition the ZR1 being used. After a month of use in different settings, I finally realize that the lighting condition is what make the ZR1 an excellent or a poor camera.I have a TZ1 for 5 years and have been a big fan of it. But recently I can't stand its slow performance so I looked for a upgrade. I finally decided on ZR1 instead of DSLR or ZS3(TZ7) because of portability and high speed focus. In outdoor the ZR1 does deliver. Today I took my 4 years old daughter out for roller skating and I was able to shoot both beautiful photos and video while I myself was rolling! I wouldn't be able to do that with a DSLR.But at indoor, the ZR1 failed quite miserably. It produced grainy picture. I have settled back to the TZ1 for indoor use now. I think the smaller lens of ZR1 is the root problem. I wish they keep the same lens size. That would be perfect!So the conclusion? I can't complain much because it costs only about $250 and it does provide a lot of value: snappy shooting, good picture quality, good zoom, ok video and ultra portability.

Reviews.Title: Perfect point and shoot
Reviews.Author: City Mouse
Reviews.Content: After spending months reading and comparing features and reviews of compact point and shoot digital cameras, I decided to take a chance on the Lumix DMC-ZR1.  I say 'take a chance' because, if you're reading this review, you've probably read (or are getting ready to read) a ton of reviews and, no doubt, noticed the range of opinions.  Also, like all advanced technological devices, nothing lasts long, you can always get a lemon, and you're replacing electronics faster than underwear.  Long and short of it, I'm thrilled with my new camera.  This is my third digital camera in 5 years (whoa! 5 years?)  Well, I love taking pictures.  The Lumix is everything you want in a compact digital without the huge price tag.  A well thought out display.  Solid construction. Feels good in the hand.  Intuitive.  Lots of scene settings. And terrfic pictures.  I've taken indoor and outdoor shots, with and without flash (and the camera allows forced flash or flash-off).  I haven't taken a bad picture, yet.  Colors are rich.  Skin tones, natural.  Inside flash doesn't wash out faces (face recognition is excellent).  I tend to do a lot of snap, snap, snapping when I'm on vacation so the image stabilizer is great for taking shots on the go.  The wide angle lens ensures you're outdoor shots will have drama.  The superfast (and ultra quiet) zoom lives up to the hype.  If you're looking at Canon Powershots or Elfs, Sony Cybershots, or Fuji Finepixs (my last camera), I recommend you consider the Lumix.  I think you're going to find the performance on a par or better than those competitors and for a much nicer pricetag.  Happy shooting!

Reviews.Title: I want to love it, but indoor low light pix just aren't doing it for me
Reviews.Author: GG1
Reviews.Content: I thought I had found the perfect camera...8x wide angle zoom: PERFECT! Love the image stabilization. It's lightweight, portable, with nice ergonomics and very easy to operate with one hand. Fits into a pocket or small purse easily. I bought the red one (love the color!) but am posting here since most of the reviews are under the black version (doesn't amazon usually combine the reviews for various colors? amazon, are you listening?)ANYWAY, I put the camera in iA mode and started taking photos of my dogs, indoors, in medium to low light. Even with flash on, the shutter speed is often 1/8 second in low light. That's fine for taking pix if the pups are sleeping...but not to record the activities of my two high-energy terriers. Many of the photos are blurry, not from camera movement but from subject movement. My 5-year old Casio Exilim EX-Z55 is producing better pix under these circumstances.I don't doubt this is a a very good camera...just not ideal for my situation. I saw another reviewer mention having his kids do a "jump test" (which this camera failed) and I think I've got pretty much the same issues. I'm going to play with changing default settings for the standard recording mode (vs iA) but what I was really hoping for was to use the iA mode with no fuss. Not sure I'll be keeping this one.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value!
Reviews.Author: Teflon Tim
Reviews.Content: I use a camera virtually every day for my work and have had several digital cameras over the years.  The ZR1 is an excellent value.For me having a strong optical zoom is critical to my work and the 8x zoom on the ZR1 is very good.  Even on the maximum zoom the new Panasonic Image Stabilization keeps things in focus.  In the past I have favored larger more bulky cameras, many times a result fo the optical zoom, but the ZR1 is one of the tiniest and compact cameras I have ever used.  In fact let me say this, for some people this camera may be too small, please note the dimensions and weight of the camera if that is of any concern to you.  Along these lines, though small in footprint, the build quality is top-notch.  It is one solid little device and nothing feels cheap about it.  For example, the USB connector door has a great feel to it and snap open and shut with a satisfying click.  Some cameras have very flimsy doors that tend to become loose or even break with repeated use.  I do not anticipate that happening with the ZR1.I like the ZR1 so much I have adopted it as my personal point and shoot camera of choice and will be taking it on my next vacation!

Reviews.Title: Works for a novice like me
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I don't know what else to say....been researching Lumix cameras for a while now.  I was going to purchase the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS3 due to the high quality of reviews and the long 12x optical zoom.  I decided to trade in the zoom for what I am told is a better optical stabilization.  This camera still has an excellent zoom (8x), and it really works well for me.  You turn it on and it is ready to take a picture in less than 5 seconds.  I put it on the setting for automatic adjustments for taking pictures, and it takes the guesswork out of what the settings need to be for the camera.  I did still have to turn off the flash once in a while manually.  I am sure that there is so much more I can do with this camera,  but to get it one day and take it on a trip, I was truly impressed.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Its what I expected
Reviews.Author: T. King
Reviews.Content: After all the reviews stating that the camera took bad indoor shots I was a little worried that I might have purchased the wrong camera that cnet spoke so highly of.  I found the in door shots to be natural looking without a lot of light brighting up areas that are dark to begin with.  The picture I took look exactly like I see it.  I love this camera its a perfect replacement for my old like new condition Olympus D40.

Reviews.Title: Best Compact yet
Reviews.Author: D. Gylland
Reviews.Content: I have owned many cams,  This is one of the best for its size and price.  Very good zoom even in macro mode.  Photo quality much better than I expected.  iA Does an excellent job,  No worries.  Highly recommended!  I use this cam 90% of the time the G10 10%.  It's always in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Not good for low light or fluorescent lighting...
Reviews.Author: Spartans1
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I returned this camera after a few months of use (had a 90 day return window) due to consistently poor photos indoors and at my children's preschool where they use fluorescent lighting. Had this camera performed well indoors, I would have kept it. My fluorescent lighting shots all had a wierd yellow tint to them - not good! My indoor shots were dark (with some lights on in the home), sometimes they'd turn out - most often not though. This was a deal breaker for me.If you are only purchasing this to use outdoors, you won't be disappointed. My outdoor shots turned out great, my indoor shots only turned out when there was plenty of sunlight coming in.Pros:* Easy to use* Compact* Performs well in taking action shots - very little blur in action mode.* Fast shot to shot time.Con:*Poor low light performance*Poor fluorescent lighting performanceI returned the ZR1 for the Canon Powershot SX120 IS and have had excellent indoor results. It's a little bulky compared to the ZR1 but I've decided photo quality is what matters most to me vs. size of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Quick and Easy Camera
Reviews.Author: SHM
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for Christmas and was very impressed.  When I saw a moment I wanted to capture, I simply pulled the camera out of my shirt pocket and snapped the picture.  You push a button to turn the camera on and it's ready to shoot in about a second and a half.  Point the camera at what you want to shoot and push the shutter release half way down to focus which takes another half second.  Push the shutter the rest of the way and you've taken the picture.  It takes about two seconds from pocket to picture, especially if you have everything set to auto.  There are of course numerous manual settings as well.  Red eye correction, automatic correction for your shaky hands (like mine), 12.1 megapixel photos and a powerful 8X zoom as well as a built in wide angle lens.  For me, its a very quick and easy to use little pocket camera that takes great photos without a bunch of fuss.  If you the kind who likes to do everything manually, this camera may not be the best choice, bowever, there are some manual settings including ISO settings and many scene selections to choose from.  A lot of nice features at a resonalbe price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera design, POOR PHOTO QUALITY
Reviews.Author: K. Keller
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks reviewing cameras and chose the ZR1...I love the contruction and the interface is easy to use-- many great scene modes.The pictures looked great on the camera's LCD screen, but once I uploaded them to my computer I realized they were not as crisp as I had hoped.I tried many different settings and most pictures appeared blurry or washed out.Luckily I purchased the camera through Amazon and was able to return it.Back to analyzing camera reviews...

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Anonymous reviewer
Reviews.Content: After doing a CONSIDERABLE amount of research on this  type of camera, I finally decided on this unit.  It was rated very high by Consumer Reports and many websites such as C-Net.  I have not been disappointed yet.  It seems very easy to use right out of the box and seems to perform as described.  We haven't owned it long, but I'm sure we will be very happy with it!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: mpv
Reviews.Content: We're very happy with the ZR1, after a few weeks (and heavy holiday use); the photos are great so far (they beat the pics from other, comparably sized & priced cameras that we've owned and used). We haven't at all experienced the "graininess" problems that others are speaking of -- our indoor pics are turning out very nice. Of course, the camera has a variety of settings (ISO, etc.) that you can play around with to customize your shots. If a true low-light champion is what you're after, I imagine there are other, more specialized choices out there (which I expect will be be larger and/or more expensive). But for a basic camera this small (and at this price level), the ZR1 is a winner, in our experience.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: M. Koinis
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  Your hand can be shaking and the picture will still be clear and in focus.  Also it powers on and is ready to take the first picture before you can even get ready.  super fast super great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Little Camera
Reviews.Author: White Lotus
Reviews.Content: My opinion is still being formed, having owned this camera for nearly a month now.Pros:- Outdoor photos during the day look very good.- Extremely portable- Zoom is powerful at 8X (especially considering how small this camera is)- Doesn't cost $300- Offers HD video resolution, with AVCHD, which means that you can shoot over 1 hour of HD video with only a 8GB SD card.- Zooms during video shooting, although the zoom moves kind of slow.Cons:- Low light photos are a disappointment (although I'm learning that for indoor shots the iA mode works pretty well)- Software to download photos could be better, requires lots of clicks to get pictures transferred, always asking confirmation buttons, "Are you sure you want to do this?"- AVCHD is hard to work with, still looking for a good video editor to make the video look good. Regular HD mode works well but takes up a lot of space on 8GB SD card (can only put 8 mins at highest quality).Panasonic has designed this camera for the world traveler in mind and guess what? I LOVE to travel! This is why their original series of cameras had the letters "TZ" in their name for "Travel Zoom". This camera has the combination of features that happens to fit for me (except for the poor low light photos). It even has a mode to input a different city and time zone so that this info is automatically stored with the picture and allows you to organize your pictures by location.There is a very handy feature that allows you to record 5 seconds of audio alongside the picture to describe what exactly is going on in the pic, very cool! This is a feature that would have come in very handy in my last trip to Bangkok. You won't find little touches like this with other cameras.Taking pictures is quick and easy with this little portable camera. Just turn it on, put it on iA mode and off you go. It has dedicated video button to start and stop the video shooting which is awkward for me, but I'm getting used to it.

Reviews.Title: Great P&S;
Reviews.Author: thescreensavers "Alex"
Reviews.Content: This Camera Replaced my Canon Powershot 800ISDaylight- Excellent photos, 8x zoom is amazingNight Time - For a point and shoot its good, not amazing but good. The Pictures do get a bit noisy but its much less then my Canon, I would say its not good for large prints, this is a common issue with all point and shoot cameras because of there small image sensor, some are better then others but do not expect SLR like picture quality in dark situations from this camera.Videos - Amazing, Again 8x zoom helps alot, I have taken videos in the dark (at outside events with minimal lighting) and during the day and this camera blew my expectations ( this camera can record in 1280x720 resolution),the mic also picks up voices very well with backround music playing.The Bottom Line:If you need a point and shoot for around (...) I would put this high up on my list, do your research to make sure it fits you :)

Reviews.Title: great picture  colors are alive
Reviews.Author: BIG CAT
Reviews.Content: Great little toy, fun to use lots of setting to get just the right one for u i'm sure!!! size is  excellent will fit anywhere, colors are amazing. I love it very happy with my choice would do it again !!!  did lots of study before making it  i get an  A  for home work.  Reta  (  NEVIS )

Reviews.Title: worst camera in 13 years
Reviews.Author: Marcos E. Campos "marc53"
Reviews.Content: I bought the ZR1 when I gave my TZ3 to my daughter. The TZ3 was the best camera I had used since I went digital in 1997. We are both real estate appraisers and take pictures in all lighting conditions. I assumed that the increased pixels in the ZR1 would provide better pictures. Starting with the first pictures I took the images were very grainy and noisy. I tried all types of settings after the iA did not provide a clear image. I honestly thought that the camera lens or sensor was damaged and sent it to Panasonic for repairs or replacement. They basically said nothing was wrong with the one I sent and sent me another one. Its pictures were only slightly better but still not something I want to use in my appraisals.I had an email and phone conversation with a tech at the Panasonic repair center. I sent him sample photos and the following link to explain one of my problems with the camera.[...]The blotches and gainyness in low light is the worst of any camera I have ever had. I need to be able to bring out detail and writing on signs under an awning on a sunny day in a photo taken from my car some 50+- feet away. This camera cannot do that. I tried to make the shadows brighter when processing it with photoshop elements levels or highlight shadow, but have no success. The high dynamic setting produces an image that is blurry with minimal lightening of the dark areas.The image stabilization does not seem to work. With my old TZ3 I could take a zoomed photo of a stain or crack on a high ceiling in a building with no lights and it would come out clear without a flash. The ZR1 will not provide a clear image. The edges of walls or books or other objects, viewed at 100% in photoshop, are indistinct dots that are out of focus.I am not satisfied with this camera and need to replace it with one that works.If you use a camera for business purposes do not buy the ZR1.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1
Reviews.Author: S. Turner
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It has a ton of features, crystal clear pictures, and its a perfect size for on-the-go people. Its very simple to use and has a pretty cool face recognition. I do have some problems with it though figuring out sometimes the difference between my wife and my daughter, but they do look alot alike. The camera is of course with easy to put pictures onto your computer by the SD card or by usb cable. I highly recommend this camera for anybody who wants an amazing point and shoot digital camera! Its definately worth the money!*Update* I recently used my camera picture and movie taking capabilities at an Avenged Sevenfold Concert. It beat all my friends cameras by a landslide! First its very portable, I barely noticied it in my pocket. What really blew me away though was the zoom! I zoomed right up to Matt Shadows and followed him around the stage from the back of the seating. The stability feature helped out also as at that zoom its real hard to keep steady, but the feature allowed me to keep right on the singer. The pictures were so clear I never used my flash as the lights on the stage provided plenty of lighting. BUY THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: James "Geek Wannabe"
Reviews.Content: So far, so good.  I've only had this camera for about a month, but from what I've seen so far it was worth every penny.  I bought it refurbished on Amazon and only paid $151.00 The menu is very easy to use I didn't even have to use the manual to start taking pics.The pics look great.  Amazing color and sharpness. This is definitely the best camera I've ever had.  I almost bought a Sony cibershot w350 because it is smaller, but I think I made the right choice in sacrificing quality over portability.  The features included are awesome, even though I haven't use most of them.  The best so far is the 8X zoom, The speed, flash on/off setting and the ultra sharp LCD screen. I usually leave it on auto until I can learn more about the advanced features. Anyone looking for their first digital camera; I highly recommend the Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Love the Lumix
Reviews.Author: reerc
Reviews.Content: Have had an array of the cheap little point n' shoot cameras, and even though I still don't consider myself an expert by any means, this Panasonic Lumix has been far and away the best one yet. It's easy to use and takes great pictures. I was skeptical about the proprietary (rather than AA) battery, but so far, it hasn't been a problem. Lastly, I wouldn't install the uploading/editing software they send with it (it was pretty clunky), go with what comes with your computer.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: S. Pogoloff
Reviews.Content: I only had this camera for a couple of weeks before it was stolen out of my suitcase (never again).  But I loved it in every way.  Only weakness (pointed out in reviews) is that the mode dial often turned while in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Very good all around camera
Reviews.Author: D. Hill
Reviews.Content: After having an unfortunate accident with my Panasonic FS7, I needed a new camera.  I dallied with the Pentax Optio P80--a horrendous experience--and promptly returned that pitiful excuse for a camera in favor of another Panasonic, the ZR1.  All in all, I am fairly impressed with the picture quality and the HD video quality.  I really like that it shoots video at 30 frames per second as opposed to some pricier Canon or Sony models which shoot 15 fps.  Although not a razor thin camera by any means, it is still very, very small and portable.I really just have two criticisms:(1) Telescopic lens: the housing to the telescopic lens is pretty flimsy.  It is the same housing that my FS7 had, and the reason I had to trash my FS7 was that it took a minor tumble on a hardwood floor right after I finished taking a zoom shot.  That flimsy plastic housing dented and cracked, and jacked up the camera.  I have played with Canons and Sonys that have sturdy metallic housings that probably would have withstood this.(2) Shooting mode dial: I don't really care for the dial that you have to turn to go from Intelligent Auto (which works very well by the way) to Video to Manual to Scene modes.  Well, I suppose I wouldn't mind it so much if it had an IA button like the FS7 did which would toggle between Intelligent Auto and your last other mode you used (e.g. Video, which I used to toggle back and forth with a lot).  Minor hassle having to turn that dial rather than having a 'hotkey'.All in all though, a great camera.

Reviews.Title: All you could ever need without bumping up to a DSLR
Reviews.Author: Shredder "More BPM!"
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera, shoots quick, starts up quick, quality is great even when set to 3 or 5 megapixles. its light, small, durable, and stylish. everything is easy to figure out and use.

Reviews.Title: Little gem with somewhat disappointing image quality
Reviews.Author: W. Chen "new_buyer111"
Reviews.Content: Got this little gem a few days ago. I could get this camera or a bigger panasonic ZS1 for the same price, I chose this for the portability and (supposedly) faster operation.First of all, it is really small for its capability, just a bit longer than the canon SD400 I own. Therefore it is very pocketable.It is also very fast at operation, as promised. It start fast, focus fast, and does not show much shutter lag. So it is a very nimble camera.One feature ZR1 does not have, but the ZS1 has, is that ZS1 could shoot continuously at 2fps indefinitely, while ZR1 is limited at 3 or 5 pictures, depending on image compression/size. I wish that I knew this ahead of my purchase.One area does disappoint me a bit though. It is the image quality and the noise. Granted, it is a small camera with a tiny sensor on which 12MP is squeezed on. I don't really appreciate the trend of "more pixel is better". But that is the way it is. I have owned Canon S30, which had 3MP on the 1/1.8 sensor. I also have a canon SD400 and a DSLR pentax  K100D. The canon S30 is known for low noise and high quality picture. The canon sd400 is not quite as clean, but manageable. Needless to say, the K100D is nearly noise free below ISO400. So I am somewhat spoiled by noise free pictures.ZR1 pictures showed quite a bit noise, even at ISO80, the lowest. The pictures do not appear very sharp, giving a feeling of haziness. Comparison of pictures of ZR1, ZS1 and Canon SX120 from a review website showed that ZS1 shows noise of similar extend and pattern (kind of block of noise, not single pixel), while the Canon SX120 pictures have similar level of noise, but finer in grainess. As the result, the pictures from the Canon SX120 looked better before and after noise reduction treatment, compared to ZR1, ZS1 pictures.Remember though, the analysis above is pretty much pixel peeking. I did not expect perfect photos from a camera this small, at this price. I will keep the camera, as it fits my needs and budget, as a pocket camera for outdoor/travel/tourism with great zoom. The photos are quite decent when not looked at pixel-by-pixel, and get better with some noise reduction.Bottom line is, ZR1 is a good camera with limitations. Keep this in mind when you purchase it, and keep it at low ISO when you use it. Then you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1 did not deliver
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife to replace her Sony Cybershot I lost while in Mexico.  I selected this camera for it's large optical zoom range, the ability to zoom while taking videos, it's small size, and it's reported ratings.  Ultimately I wanted decent quality photos and decent quality video.  Unfortunately the photo and video quality were unacceptable.  Indoor photos were grainy and generally of poor quality.  The video was glitchy and also of poor quality.  The photo quality of the Cybershot I lost was far superior.  I returned the Lumix DMC-ZR1 and purchased a Sony Cybershot with lots of great features for less than the Lumix.  I rated the camera 1 star overall even though I rated other areas higher because the picture quality was so poor.One thing I can rate 5 stars was Amazon's return policy.  I delayed returning the camera because I was worried that I would have difficulty returning an electronic device.  It was far easier than I expected.  I just logged into my account and after a few clicks UPS was scheduled to stop by the house the next day to pick it up.  A few days later I was notified by e-mail that the camera had been received and the purchase amount would be refunded to my credit card.  I did nearly all my Christmas shopping on Amazon this year and you can bet I will return to Amazon again and again.

Reviews.Title: Like another reviewer said...
Reviews.Author: GC
Reviews.Content: Like one of the other reviewers said, this camera looks good on paper, but the picture quality doesn't come close to other P&S; cameras.  I've used Casio and Canon before and they both took good pics.  I still have an SD550 (7.1MP) and it takes much better shots than this Panasonic.The noise and lack of sharpness in the panasonic pictures was more than I could handle.If I could, I would post the two pictures I took (one with SD550 and one with DMC-ZR1).  If it wasn't for the smaller size of the Canon pic, you'd swear it was from the newer camera.I just printed out the return shipping label.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Dan T. L.
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for just under three years every day at work.  I ran over 17k exposures through it and then passed it down to my Assistant when I upgraded to a Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZS 10.  ¡It continues to work very well every day!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: P. Stahl "PJS"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's user friendly and takes really good pictures. I took a few videos of my sons band at a festival and I was pleased with the quality of the picture and the sound.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Lori
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera about a month now and couldn't be happier!!  It is an awesome little camera.  I wanted a smaller camera to use on occasion instead of just having my big SLR to haul around.  It is very easy to use and very small so it's really easy to take with you.  The zoom is decent.  It has alot of neat features.  I love the feature where you can put in your child and/or pets name and birthday and it tags the photos of them with their name and age.  You can take short movies with it.  It is very easy to upload your photos to the computer.  Overall, it's just a great camera!  You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix Camera
Reviews.Author: Gayle K. Belter
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that would easily fit into a small purse or pocket that I could take with me when visiting, vacationing etc. I love this camera and have not even used half of the features available on it yet. The photos are great and the zoom feature is fine for my needs. Much more convenient to have a small camera instead of having to carry a larger camera and case along with a purse when I leave the house.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: R. Levy "Salsera"
Reviews.Content: I only just started using the camera about a month ago, but so far I'm very pleased. First, it comes with a pouch, which is very exciting (and totally unexpected). The rotating selector switch is a bit sensitive and will move at the slightest touch. While I haven't printed any photos yet, the photo quality on the camera and on my computer is fabulous. There are lots of fun features on the camera I have yet to try, but the menu is pretty easy to work with, once you get a hang of it. The camera's not quite as compact as some of the Canon Elf ultra-compacts. It all depends on what you're looking for from a camera. But overall, I'm very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: An Amazing Little Camera
Reviews.Author: IamJack
Reviews.Content: I have a Nikon SLR, a Sony HD video camera... and the Panasonic is the one I am always using.  For a pocket camera, it takes great pictures and video.  The only downside is that I probably won't be using my other much more "expensive" cameras very much.

Reviews.Title: Amazing - especially for the price
Reviews.Author: dande2169
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. I bought it because I am about to have my very first child and I wanted a new camera so I could capture as many precious moments as possible. I did a lot of research and found that this camera was very highly rated/recommended by CNET. The high def video is amazing and the camera takes not only high quality pictures, but it takes them really quickly. Really great deal for the price!

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-ZR1
Reviews.Author: J. Crum
Reviews.Content: Over all good product. Build is second to none. I own other Lumix products, this is on par with them. Some times the pictures are not great in auto or Ai mode.

Reviews.Title: Simple and efficient
Reviews.Author: Nicholas G. Sterling "Frequent Traveler"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent dummy proof camera.  Easy menus and features.  Excellent zoom, very quiet and the video quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Soild point and shoot. I think, one of the best "all in one"
Reviews.Author: Regan Cheng "MysticX23"
Reviews.Content: Whats so good about this camera? Its one of the best "ALL IN ONE" cameras you can find. Why?1) You can take very good 12mp photo's with it. Not only does it have a very wide angle (25mm!), but the 8x zoom and Image Stabilization allows for a lot of flexibility.2) You can take HD video's with it.3) Its very small. Yes, there are 12mp 10x-12x, HD capable zoom cameras out there (Canon SX200, Panasonic ZS3,...), but they are much larger.4) It also has a lot of fun modes to take photo's with (pincushion effect, high dynamic range effect, stretch effect, etc..)I was hard pressed to find anything bad to say about it, BUT, after 2 weeks of taking photo's with it, I did have to return it. I noticed a dark spot on the bottom left of the pictures (also visible on the LCD). I tried to clean the lens, but now I think its a dust particle on the inside of the lens or the sensor. Now, I think I got a defective one, and probably most of the ZR1's out there are good, but since I did have to return it, I can only give it 4 stars and not 5. If I had to be really really picky, I didn't like the menu interface either or the top scrolling wheel. I wish it could have been more like Canon or Nikon, but that may be just my personal preference.

Reviews.Title: Looking into returning it
Reviews.Author: B. Espanol
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera since November of 09 and from the first few shots I took from the camera i was disappointed.  the colors were off.  But I decided to give it some time and try it out in different environments and settings and now I can honestly say I don't like this.  In low'ish light situations it fails.  Fuzzy (noise) pictures galore.  Forget that romantic date picture in the restaurant.  Decent light situations, like a house party or a Christmas party or a new years party?  Fail, fail, fail.  In all three situations my camera did the worst out of everyone else's at the party.  Now these were indoor shots in apartments with lights on every where.  I tried the different settings and the pretty much all failed.  Too noisy, off color, bad image stabilization.  The worst part of using this camera for a social evening is that the shooting speed is horrible.  Maybe I got a really bad lemon but sometimes the button to take the picture doesn't want to work.  So I'm just standing there missing the shot or making my friends stand around like idiots as my camera tries to take the picture.Out door pictures suffer from off colors and noise.There is NOTHING HD about the video shot on this.  Don't even try buying this for that.I know I've had it around 2 and a halve months now but I want to look into returning this or maybe having the factory send me a replacement.  If i get one and its better I'll be sure to update this.  For now stick with a cannon power shot.  I bought one for my ex two years ago and her pictures blew my cameras away.

Reviews.Title: Grainy pictures and videos
Reviews.Author: Avnish Bhardwaj
Reviews.Content: I was initially planning to buy DMC-ZS3 because of its awesome reviews however decided to purchase this one because of small size and almost similar features. This is a feature packed camera for its price however its performance let me down. Almost all the pictures I took indoor came out very grainy and blurry. Even though this camera can shoot HD videos but the results are nowhere close to the quality you would expect from a HD video. Videos had some sort of noise even on a bright day. Pictures above ISO 200 came out very bad especially when I compared them to my four year old 5 Megapixel Nikon camera.I borrowed Canon SD780 from one of my friend and compared the picture and video quatity in similar settings and Canon was far better in all respects. Initially I thought I might have received a bad piece. However, after reading few other reviews from other users who had similar issues I promptly returned it to amazon.

Reviews.Title: Hoped for better
Reviews.Author: LL22
Reviews.Content: I anxiously awaited this camera after having sat in front of my computer for 3 days reading review after review.  I can't say that my time was wasted because although I think I take great pics I learned a lot of the terminology that I didn't understand previously.  That being said I thought I had narrowed it down to exactly what I wanted.  The zoom was important to me and the fact that this camera had 8x optical was great!  However every single picture I took indoors that I zoomed in on was horribly grainy!  In fact a lot the indoor shots I took turned out grainy and or blurry!  I was able to get great outdoor shots but since at least 50% of my pics will be taken indoors this camera just doesn't do it for me. The flash also seemed to go off excessively even when I was outside unless I was standing in direct sun light. I also did what I call the "jump test" I have my kids jump in front of the camera indoors on the auto setting and I take a picture of them to see if it turns out blurry.  This camera failed miserably.  I tried every setting and uploaded pics 2 separate times then gave up and shipped it back to amazon.  I then went out and bought a canon sx110is, which I love so far, and I also bought the Panasonic Lumix FS8.  The FS8 cost me $100 at Wal-mart and preformed great!  It even surpassed my expectations on the "jump test".  I have owned a couple of Panasonic Lumix cameras but the Lumix DMC-ZR1 sadly fell short.Just a side note :-)When I wrote this review I wanted the average person looking for a good point and shoot to get it. I read countless reviews, while good, just contained way more information than I really needed to know for what I was looking for. I still love the cannon camera I purchased. Other than the battery life not being very long it takes great indoor/outdoor shots. I can even zoom as far as it goes indoor and it takes beautiful pictures. I know it isn't a real "technical" review but for all the Mom's and Dad's out there who just want to take a quick indoor shot and not get to close to the subject as not to disturb the "perfect pic" This just may not be the camera you are looking for. Thanks to everyone for your picture taking advice.

Reviews.Title: Dust on CCD
Reviews.Author: Gift Card Recipient
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera just over a year ago.  All of the sudden there are black spots on my pictures due to dust on the ccd.  Panasonic said it would cost $120 to fix.  A friend of mine had the same problem with his same type of camera.  Also, Panasonic's customer service said they have received calls on the same issue.  This is poor customer service for something that is clearly a major design flaw.  I will never buy another Panasonic camera.

Reviews.Title: A++++++
Reviews.Author: Geronimo Centeno "Guaroman"
Reviews.Content: Excelente, buen item, llego perfecto y en buen estado, empaque fácil de abrir, 100% satisfecho, lo recomiendo a toda la comunidad

Reviews.Title: Lumix Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: algonquin301
Reviews.Content: Great little camera, easy to use and sharp pictures. Recommended by a friend who had just purchased the same camera.  I am very pleased at the quality and low cost.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera to fit in your pocket.
Reviews.Author: Todd K
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a cross country trip last year.  I was looking for something that had some of the advanced features you'd find in an advanced point and shoot, but still wanted it to fit in my front pocket comfortably.For the most part, it does just what I needed it to do.  My only complaint is with low-light pictures.  There tends to be a lot of noise in the photos.  Other than that, its a solid device.  I really like the size and the convenience.  Its def. worth having along with you to take pictures that you want to come out stronger than your phone camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera with dast shutter speed
Reviews.Author: Bruce
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera as customer reviews indicated and the shutter speed is the fasted among this type of camera. They don't make them this fast any more.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for the price
Reviews.Author: MattA
Reviews.Content: For this price (especially the refurbished unit), it is the best deal for the buck. It is MUCH smaller and lighter than other cameras out there that produce similar quality photographs. If you are looking for a camera that is both small/light, takes good quality pictures, and is not expensive, then you can't go wrong with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Lumix zr1
Reviews.Author: plvan
Reviews.Content: 'I bought this camera for its portability.  I am constantly surprised by its picture quality, andversatility.  This is a really great product

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: I. Gregor "Smartshopper"
Reviews.Content: It takes great pictures and videos.  The only negative is that in bright light it is difficult to see the image on the screen when taking a picture.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Jorge Leon Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, you get high quality photos and videos.  The approach works wonderfully. I am very happy with this camera and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Really nice camera
Reviews.Author: Lorri "Ljmeste"
Reviews.Content: This was a birthday gift for a teenage girl. She uses it on a regular basis and feels lost without it. It works great and is the envy of all her friends because of the telephoto quality. Video features are great as well. It was delivered quickly and as promised. Thank you Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use Great Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Jones
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to find this camera for $[...] under retail. The picture quality is great, as long as you use the best setting. The IA (Intelligent Auto) does a really good job if you just let it. I'm having a hard time figuring out how to get the Panoramic feature to splice the final images together, and the information is not in the online owner's manual. I bought this camera to document my study abroad to London, and was not at all disappointed. If you want to see images taken from this camera go to [...] search maxeagar and look up "Chelsea's Pictures" every single one was taken with this camera. The battery life is pretty exceptional, too. For the 15 days I was in London/Wales I only charged the battery once, and it wasn't even necessary in spite of the close to 300 pictures I took.

Reviews.Title: Great camera except in low light
Reviews.Author: Jason Shopper
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price.  I use it for real estate pictures.  The wide angle lense definitely captures more with little to no distortion.  However, this camera does not perform well in low light conditions.  I don't take pictures any of my interior real estate pictures on cloudy days with this camera.Overall good quality camera, quick start up, excellent photo quality in all but low light conditions.

Reviews.Title: Lumix camera
Reviews.Author: John P. Post Sr. "Big John"
Reviews.Content: I like the features and especially the zoom.The package size is small and I can keep the camera in my pocket.I'm learning how to use the many features.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1
Reviews.Author: J. Regalado
Reviews.Content: This is a great little compact camera that takes great pictures.  I only wish the product information would have given details on the date/time stamp feature.  I wanted a camera with the ability to have the date/time stamp if I decided to turn the feature on.  This camera does not allow for this option.  If I want the date/time stamp, I have to manually place it on each picture.  This process requires about 4 steps for each and every picture. To top it off, if I want the date/stamp on the photo, it will only save it as a 2 megapixel picture.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Carter "tcarter8208"
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful for stills, easy to use.  The flash is so good that pics can be taken in total darkness and look great.  The picture quality is high, which is great if you are printing them, and not so great if you are uploading/attaching them to an email.  It is not so great for video.

Reviews.Title: small cam for a great price
Reviews.Author: C. Zepeda "Los Z"
Reviews.Content: Perfect for on the go shots, good zoom for such a small cam and great price.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix Camera
Reviews.Author: Craig Sopo
Reviews.Content: Overall a good camera.  The 8x zoom is fantastic.  Menu items are a bit hard to navigate for the uninitiated.

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera.
Reviews.Author: Vicky L. Kunderer
Reviews.Content: This was a very good purchase for us.  We wanted something lighter weight and small enough to slip into a pocket for everyday use.  The camera is very user friendly and we were vary happy with the quality of the photos and the video!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Timothy J. Marshall
Reviews.Content: I like this camera a lot. Performs as expected after much research. Small size is very easy to take anywhere.

Reviews.Title: POOOOR indoor images
Reviews.Author: Sartaz
Reviews.Content: really really bad indoor picture quality. uncomparable with any other digital camera.. my six year old olypus c4000 took way way better  pictures.  ZR1 gave me the worst experience I could receive from a digital camera.I will return the ZR1 as I received a ZS3 which is comparable to other cameras in the market ( i mean its way way better than a ZR1)don't be fooled by the reviews...they compare picture quality in good lighting (not even slightly bad lighting).... and Dpreview and the top reviewers did not review it yet.

Reviews.Title: Grainy, Choppy, Noisy Pictures
Reviews.Author: Ryan Sieker
Reviews.Content: The pictures taken with this camera are poor. I played with all the settings, and even brought in extra lighting for indoor shots. Every picture, was grainy/noisy. The detail was very poor even for a lower end point and click. My cell phone takes about the same quality shots.I'm returning this camera today. If it can't take a picture, who cares about the rest of the bells and whistles.

Reviews.Title: Spot inside the lens
Reviews.Author: John H. Otto
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera, but don't buy it unless you don't mind having a spot on your pictures.  It's compact, takes great pictures, but a few months ago, this spot started showing up on our pictures.  In researching on the web, I have discovered this is a common problem with Panasonic.  You can take it to a camera shop to be fixed, but many users report it coming back.  Apparently dust gets in along the zoom.  That flaw has ruined an otherwise great camera

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: just a shopper "Jo"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for an upcoming vacation. We haven't gone yet so not sure how it will do. But the pictures we have taken around the house have come out very well. Haven't figures out all the features yet, but the ones we have used worked well.

Reviews.Title: So far its a go.
Reviews.Author: C. Tennis "C. Tennis"
Reviews.Content: I can't say a lot as I have not had a chance to use this camera very much yet.So far I like everything about it that I have gotten to use. Good picture quality.Easy to work with. So very light to carry.

Reviews.Title: great camera, and gorgeous!
Reviews.Author: Mango 25
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a couple months ago...and have taken more pictures in that time than I have in the past three years. It is just so tempting to take out this small, gorgeous camera and snap a photo. Would totally recommend it. Though I haven't really messed with the features, I am sure I can take even more amazing pictures if I learned how to really use the camera.

Reviews.Title: Such a challenge to hold
Reviews.Author: S. Burke
Reviews.Content: After much research and reading a zillion reviews I decided to order this camera.  I never found one in person to hold or I would have made a different selection.  The camera is super small so it fits perfectly in a pocket.  However I can barely use it.  There is nothing to grip and right where I want to put my thumb is a button that makes the camera zoom all the way out.  Poor design.It is also not as quick as the stats led me to expect but it is faster than the Canon I was replacing.  Outside, natural light photos are very good.  Indoor, flash pictures are just so-so.I would not recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Not a replacement for an SLR
Reviews.Author: Steve Martin "Steve"
Reviews.Content: I was hoping the advancements in electronics would help this get as good a picture as an SLR, but no chance. There are tons of auto modes...too many. I just want an easy to use camera that takes good pics by without too much complexity, but there is a lot under the hood on this one and it's easy to mess up. There are a few different menus and it's hard to find your way back to some of the settings. This is my first small camera though so I didn't know what I was getting into, and I'm sure all the cameras in this range would have the same issues. I'm sure these issues would disappear if I were willing to sit down with the book for a bit and study...but I'm not. I have too many other gadget manuals that are calling out to me.On the positive side, it's very small and everyone in the family uses it and some pictures do turn out great. The batter lasts a long time too. My kids love it.

Reviews.Title: Pictures are not sharp at all. A lemon perhaps?
Reviews.Author: William L. Shackleford
Reviews.Content: I purchased a factory-refurbished camera from an Amazon partner and deeply regret it. The image sharpness is totally unacceptable, even with a tripod in bright daylight, for distant scenery. Despite its 12 Million pixels, I have taken much better pictures with 3 Megapixel camera and just as good with a one-megapixel Kodak when digital cameras first came out. I have returned it to Panasonic for a replacement, which (I am told) will also be refurbished. The camera comes with no cable for TV readout -- a non-HD connector is available at extra cost. I had expected 1080p High-def; a big letdown there. (Other Lumix models may offer it). The instructions you need for this camera's many settings are explained in a 170-page CD-ROM .pdf file only. The paperwork you get is only about 15 pages. I tried to order a hard copy by email and got no reply. It is hard to believe that a Leica lens could take such bad pictures. Perhaps the autofocus mechanism or algorithm is at fault. If the replacement they send me is just as bad, I will just have to throw it away.On the positive side, it looks nice and the exposure levels are just about right. The LCD screen is just bright enough to use in broad daylight, but it was difficult to evaluate image sharpness and composition outdoors in daylight. You may need bi- or trifocals to see it clearly if you are over 45.

Reviews.Title: Its Ok
Reviews.Author: Daniel Vilera
Reviews.Content: Its an ok camera for the $200 range, if you have to pay full price then dont buy it! It can take acceptable indoor flash pictures, better than most of the cameras in this range, and the 8x zoom is great.

Reviews.Title: All I expected
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Kolbe
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera because it had a greater optical zoom than most cameras(10X), plus further digital zoom. It has a higher pixel count than the others in it's class who had slightly larger zoom lenses. Not overly feature rich, but then how much do you really use them. Good size, able to control one handed and focuses quickly with good re-cycle time on the flash. Haven't really used the video other to try it out, but with 12 megapixels, would think it is adequate.  Only drawback is the actual trigger for the picture could be a little easier to find, but that is pretty picky.

Reviews.Title: Would not reccomend
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: It wokred for approx one year and then the shutter began opening and closing only partway. Recent photo quality is not good. Have to buy another camera now.This was first and last time I buy Panasonic Lumix

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy this Camera
Reviews.Author: tomt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to India/Nepal. Forget theultrazoom as the resulting pics look like crap. The cameradoes not seem to pick up blue skies well, unless a lot ofsky is featured in the composition. I then took the camera ona five-month trip to SE Asia. Somehow, dust got inside the lens,so pictures now have "spots" and "hairs" on them. I see thatothers too complain about the dust and that for $120 one canget it cleaned. It is not worth it. Also, I am getting a lotof error messages when I turn on the camera. So, after just10 months of use, the camera is near dead.

Reviews.Title: DMZ-ZR1 - not a bad buy
Reviews.Author: Dean "Dean"
Reviews.Content: Takes nice pictures.  Very good price point for a 12MP camera.  Very compact.  No frills.  Does not include a CF disk or carrying case.  Most pictures are fine although not the best in either action shots or low light.  Still, I'm impressed for what it does offer and considering I upgraded from a very old 2MP camera, this is leaps and bounds above that.

Reviews.Title: DMC-ZR1 appears to have one big flaw-Updated February 10,2010
Reviews.Author: d. pacino
Reviews.Content: Update February 10,2010:Panasonic got back to me about the time/date stamp issue, below is their response:"Unfortunately you will have to manually put the date stamp on the pictures. There is no automatic on and off switch for this."Yuk!  So we have three choices:1. Manually and individually add the time/stamp feature to all of the pictures or the pictures you want.  Depending on the size of your memory card and how many pictures you want the time/date stamp, you may want to have a bowl of ice handy to soak your sore thumb afterwards.2. Someone at work told me I can get a software package that allows me to put the time/date stamp on the picture.  Our lives are busy enough without having to deal with another software package in order to put a time/date stamp on a picture.3. Return this camera and get a camera that has a simple and global on-off time/date stamp feature.We are choosing the 3rd option.  On a general note, I like that Amazon lets its customers write reviews.  I think it helps people make decisions and helps solve problems.  It also allows people to sort through what they think is an important issue or not. For example, if I had known about the time/date stamp feature of this camera, I would have never purchased it in the first place.  Maybe my review of this camera will help someone.  Thanks.Original Comment:We must be missing something with the date/time stamp. The other two digital cameras that we had gave us the ability to turn on or turn off the date stamp. We cannot find where this camera allows you to do that. All we can find is the ability to select which pictures you want to time/date stamp after you take the picture {only up to about 40 at a time}. and there is not a select all feature. You have to manually select each individual picture {even if you select multi} that you want to time/date stamp. Hopefully, someone else who owns this camera can tell me I'm missing something. Otherwise, we'll be returning this one for one that has a true time/date stamp feature. With, having two young kids, the time/date stamp feature on the pictures is something we really enjoyed. I never thought that this camera would be such a pain with this feature.

Reviews.Title: Do not purchase from Galorco, Inc.
Reviews.Author: Dissatified customer
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this item via Amazon marketplace, with Galorco as the seller.  I did receive the item promptly and in good condition.  When I wanted to return the item, there was absolutely no contact information for the seller in the packaging, not a phone number, address, email or return policy.  I emailed Amazon and Galorco via my order information and it took several days for Galorco to reply with their return policy and address.  I sent the product back in it's original condition within two weeks of receiving as was charged a 20% restocking fee.  Totally unacceptable, I have returned electronics in the past from other stores and was never out any money.  Terrible customer service.  I would not recommend purchasing from this seller, if something is wrong with the item you order or you do not like it, you will not get a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Some shortcomings
Reviews.Author: T. Veimo
Reviews.Content: I've experienced two issues with this camera; it doesn't containt too many language choices for on screen text, eg. I cannot select norwegian language. The second is that it doesn't allow erasure of images from the camera from within iphoto after importing images.

Reviews.Title: Be careful, one drop and you'll be shopping for a new camera!
Reviews.Author: Eric Zajac
Reviews.Content: Loved the camera, great pictures, hd video, features and a huge zoom for a compact camera.  Only issue is I dropped the camera once on a wood floor, the zoom got bent and now it won't close or take pictures.  Disappointed in the fragile construction of the zoom lens.  Took about 50 pics and one drop later I was in Mexico for 10 days without a working camera.

Reviews.Title: Now wonder it's inexpensive
Reviews.Author: I Live in 91607
Reviews.Content: I've been in the market for several months to replace my broken Panny LX3 so I decided to try Panny again. In a few words:  "awful photos!"  Don't waste your money.

ProductInfo.Features:
12.1-megapixel resolution
25mm wide-angle Leica DC Vario-Elmar lens; 8x zoom, Power O.I.S.
Capture HD video at 1280x720, 30fps
2.7-inch  TFT LCD screen
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-ZR1 12.1MP Digital Camera with 8x POWER Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Black)
